history.proof: intros n m p H. shelve.

exceptions.exn: In environment n, m, p : nat H : p + n >= p + m Unable to unify "p + n < p + m" with "n >= m".

exceptions.tactic: apply (plus_ge_compat_l p n m) in contra.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall n m p : nat, p + n >= p + m -> n >= m

Premises:
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
plus_ge_compat_l : forall n m p : nat, n >= m -> p + n >= p + m
NatAux.mult_ge_compat_rev_l : forall n m p : nat, p * n >= p * m -> 0 < p -> n >= m
NatAux.mult_ge_compat_l : forall n m p : nat, n >= m -> p * n >= p * m
plus_le_compat_l : forall n m p : nat, n <= m -> p + n <= p + m
Nat.le_trans : forall n m p : nat, n <= m -> m <= p -> n <= p
NatAux.mult_lt_compat_l : forall n m p : nat, n < m -> 0 < p -> p * n < p * m
mult_le_compat_l : forall n m p : nat, n <= m -> p * n <= p * m
ge_dec : forall n m : nat, {n >= m} + {~ n >= m}
inj_ge : forall n m : nat, n >= m -> (Z.of_nat n >= Z.of_nat m)%Z
ge_Nge : forall n m : nat, (N.of_nat n >= N.of_nat m)%N -> n >= m
le_ge_dec : forall n m : nat, {n <= m} + {n >= m}
not_lt : forall n m : nat, ~ n < m -> n >= m
not_ge : forall n m : nat, ~ n >= m -> n < m
BinNatDef.N.add = fun n m : N => match n with | 0%N => m | N.pos p => match m with | 0%N => n | N.pos q => N.pos (p + q) end end : N -> N -> N Arguments BinNatDef.N.add (_ _)%N_scope
Nat2Z.inj_ge : forall n m : nat, n >= m < -> (Z.of_nat n >= Z.of_nat m)%Z
nat_of_P_lt_Lt_compare_complement_morphism : forall p q : positive, Pos.to_nat p < Pos.to_nat q -> Pos.compare_cont Eq p q = Lt
growing_prop : forall (Un : nat -> R) (n m : nat), Un_growing Un -> n >= m -> (Un n >= Un m)%R
RingMicromega.ge_bool_cases : forall n m : nat, if RingMicromega.ge_bool n m then n >= m else n < m
IZR_ge : forall n m : Z, (n >= m)%Z -> (IZR n >= IZR m)%R
nat_compare_ge : forall n m : nat, n >= m < -> (n ?= m) <> Lt
Cauchy_crit = fun Un : nat -> R => forall eps : R, (eps > 0)%R -> exists N : nat, forall n m : nat, n >= N -> m >= N -> (R_dist (Un n) (Un m) < eps)%R : (nat -> R) -> Prop Arguments Cauchy_crit _%function_scope
dec_ge : forall n m : nat, Decidable.decidable (n >= m)
BinIntDef.Z.of_N = fun n : N => match n with | 0%N => 0%Z | N.pos p => Z.pos p end : N -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.of_N _%N_scope
Z.le_ge : forall n m : Z, (n <= m)%Z -> (m >= n)%Z
tech2 : forall (An : nat -> R) (m n : nat), m < n -> sum_f_R0 An n = (sum_f_R0 An m + sum_f_R0 (fun i : nat => An (S m + i)%nat) (n - S m))%R
plus_INR : forall n m : nat, INR (n + m) = (INR n + INR m)%R
BinNatDef.N.mul = fun n m : N => match n with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos p => match m with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos q => N.pos (p * q) end end : N -> N -> N Arguments BinNatDef.N.mul (_ _)%N_scope

lt_eq_lt_dec : forall n m : nat, {n < m} + {n = m} + {m < n}
Nat.lt_le_incl : forall n m : nat, n < m -> n <= m
pos = fun p : posreal => let (pos, _) := p in pos : posreal -> R pos is a coercion
le_lt_dec : forall n m : nat, {n <= m} + {m < n}

gt_S_le : forall n m : nat, S m > n -> n <= m
lt_not_le : forall n m : nat, n < m -> ~ m <= n
gt_le_S : forall n m : nat, m > n -> S n <= m
lt_le_S : forall n m : nat, n < m -> S n <= m
le_not_lt : forall n m : nat, n <= m -> ~ m < n
lt_n_S : forall n m : nat, n < m -> S n < S m

``` 
intros n m p H.
apply (not_ge (p + n) (p + m)).
intros contra.
apply (plus_ge_compat_l p n m) in contra.
contradiction.
Qed.

original: intros n m p H. apply (not_ge (p + n) (p + m)). intros contra. apply (plus_ge_compat_l p n m) in contra. contradiction.
